result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan J. Clendenning was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>2500-10,000g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)4.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>2500-10,000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, including DNA surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Eligible for challenge incarceration and earned release after 18 months if revoked.
Maintain absolute sobriety while on probation.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Compy with other assessments, treatments, and programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assesssment and DOC.
All prescriptions to  be filled from from one pharmacy.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Sign releases of information for assessments, medications, pharmacies and/or treatments.
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge.
Provide DNA testing if not already done so.
**Wage assignment is to continue until all atty fees and costs are paid in full**
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time, at least 40 hours per week.
Complete and AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Complete 50 hours of community service. At least half must be at the Portage County Parks Department.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places
Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.
First 6 months must be in jail, second half may be on GPS electronic monitoring if approved by Jail and risk assessment. Report to jail today. Sentence to commence within 60 days.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

miscConds.notes: Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dylan J. Clendenning in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation agent is also present.

2:06 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea today.

Atty Cousins did receive a copy of the PSI after a plea was entered in April.
Atty Barkley also received a copy of the PSI.

Court has read the PSI report and has detailed notes.
Court addresses the parties.

State has no corrections from a factual standpoint.
Atty Barkley has no corrections from a factual standpoint.

No witnesses will be called.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Atty Barkley addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
6 Years Prison sentence, imposed and stayed
3 yrs Initial Confinement
3 yrs extended supervision
Eligible for challenge incarceration and earned release after 18 months if revoked
Probation for a period of  3 years
Conditions:
Complete and AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations
Complete 50 hours of community service. At least half must be at the Portage County Parks Department
Maintain absolute sobriety while on probation
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Compy with other assessments, treatments, and programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assesssment and DOC
All prescriptions to  be filled from from one pharmacy
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances
Sign releases of information for assessments, medications, pharmacies and/or treatments
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time, at least 40 hours per week
Provide DNA testing if not already done so
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay attorney fees
**Wage assignment is to continue until all atty fees and costs are paid in full**
If revoked, conditions of extended supervision will be concurrent to what is on probation.

Count 3:
Jail sentence for 12 Months
Huber granted for work and counseling
First 6 months must be in jail, second half may be on GPS electronic monitoring if approved by Jail and risk assessment 
Report to jail today
Sentence to commence within 60 days
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
60 days to pay or set up payment plan

Count 6:
6 Years Prison sentence, imposed and stayed
3 yrs Initial Confinement
3 yrs extended supervision
Concurrent to Count 1  
Eligible for challenge incarceration and earned release after 18 months if revoked
Probation for a period of 3 years
Concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

 Appeal rights are addressed

Prior: 4446 Custer Road, Stevens Point, WI 54482

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on July 26, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Dylan J. Clendenning in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

4:08 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea today.

There is a plea agreement.

Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 3 and Count 6.
Counts 2, 4 and 5 will be dismissed and read in.

State requests the Court to order a PSI.
State will cap recommendations at 3 years prison. If PSI does not recommend prison, then State will not recommend prison.
Defense is free to argue.

Atty Barkley concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1: GUILTY
Defendant enters a plea of: Count 3: GUILTY
Defendant enters a plea of: Count 6: GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Barkley for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
Penalty enhancers do apply.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 2: Dismissed and read in
Count 3: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 4: Dismissed and read in
Count 5: Dismissed and read in
Count 6: Contrary to the statute section stated therein

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI.
PSI to be completed by July 12th.
Copies forwarded to counsel to prepare sentencing arguments
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Plea hearing on April 26, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dylan J. Clendenning in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing is set for a Motion to Suppress Statements Based Upon the Issue of Voluntariness of the Statement.

1:39 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Court makes statements regarding the motion being held today.
Parties are ready to proceed.
Atty Constable makes statements regarding utilizing the same exhibit (#1) she used at the last hearing or if the Court would prefer she mark a new exhibit.
Atty Barkley does not have any objection to Atty Constable using Exhibit #1 previously marked.
1:43 p.m.  Atty Constable questions if she should call her witness to establish the foundation of the video.
Atty Barkley will stipulate to the foundation of the video and makes additional statements.
1:45 p.m.  Atty Constable plays the video.
Atty Constable indicates that the first video she played was 5 minutes and 52 seconds long and the second video she will be playing is 26 minutes and 37 seconds long.
2:18 p.m.  Atty Constable is opening the 3rd and final video which is approx., 5 minutes long.
2:23 p.m.  Atty Constable states that she would like to replay the last couple of seconds as there is a discrepancy in the wording "eventually" which should be changed to "essentially".   Atty Barkley would stipulate to this change in wording.  Atty Constable will not replay Exhibit #1 do to the stipulation of Atty Barkley.
Atty Constable questions the defense if they would stipulate that this witness has laid the foundation from a previous hearing; Atty Barkley so stipulates.
Court indicates that this hearing is a continuation from a previous date.
2:27 p.m.  Detective Noel is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Constable.
2:34 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Barkley.
No re-direct by Atty Constable.
2:41 p.m.  Witness is excused.
State has no further witnesses or evidence for today's hearing.
2:42 p.m.  Dylan Clendenning is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Barkley.
2:47 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Constable.
Atty Barkley has no re-direct.
2:52 p.m.  Witness is excused.
Atty Constable gives argument regarding the motion.
3:02 p.m.  Atty Barkley gives argument regarding the motion.

BY THE COURT:  
Motion to Suppress Statements is DENIED.
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Statements Based Upon the Issue of Voluntariness of the Statement

P#1 - CD (not scanned)
P#2 - Copy of Constitutional Rights

2:25 p.m. Defendant Dylan J. Clendenning in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's Motion to Suppress - Issue of Miranda Rights. Exhibit # P1 & #P2 are marked. ADA Constable calls witness, Detective Noel, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
2:54 p.m. Cross exam by Atty Barkley. Objections by the State Motion only address the Miranda Rights. BTC: Court sustains objection.
3:01 p.m. Final statements
BTC: Motion to Suppress - Denied.
Bond is continued.

Attorney Jerod Barkley in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:38 p.m.  Court calls the case.  

Court makes statements.  Matter has been rescheduled.

Motion hearing at 01-29-2016 01:30 pm.
Jury trial at 03-09-2016 08:00 am.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

BY THE COURT: 
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Dylan J. Clendenning in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:46 p.m.  Court calls case
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

3:47 p.m.  Detective Brian Noel is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Witness identifies the defendant.  Record reflects that the witness has identified the defendant.
3:52 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Barkley.
3:53 p.m.  Objection by Atty Cousins; Court will allow question.
3:55 p.m.  Objection by Atty Cousins question asked/answered; sustained.
Court clarifies information for Atty Barkley.
3:58 p.m.  Objection by Atty Cousins; sustained.
No follow up by Atty Cousins.
Witness is excused. 

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

Atty Cousins files Information today.
